bug.author: sanidhyamangal
bug.summary: Keras: model.fit_generator or model.fit not working properly
bug.description:
Please make sure that this is a bug. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:bug_template System information
Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): Yes OS Platform and Distribution: Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary TensorFlow version (use command below): 2.2.0-rc3 Python version: 3.6.9 CUDA/cuDNN version: (colab) GPU model and memory: (colab)
Describe the current behavior While using model.fit or model.fit_generator the sub iterations in epoch shows unknown number of iterations which is goes on despite surpassing the batch size. Describe the expected behavior While using model.fit or model.fit_generator the sub iterations in epoch must be definite.
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem. If possible, please share a link to <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1dWbszUUjRagXyJUUqjdsM1yXtaAmKc23>Colab</denchmark-link> . Other info / logs Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached. WARNING:tensorflow:From <ipython-input-23-2da3481afcb0>:1: Model.fit_generator (from tensorflow.python.keras.engine.training) is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Instructions for updating: Please use Model.fit, which supports generators. Epoch 1/20 13/Unknown - 20s 2s/step - loss: 1.0732 - accuracy: 0.2602

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanidhyamangal>@sanidhyamangal</denchmark-link>
I am not able to access the colab link you have provided. Please, provide access so i can try to reproduce the issue in our environment.It helps us in localizing the issue faster.Thanks!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ravikyram>@ravikyram</denchmark-link> , I have provided you the access, kindly check.
I checked the colab notebook and was able to reproduce the issue. For now, you may use tf -2.1 which does not contain this issue.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jetjodh>@jetjodh</denchmark-link> , I already rolled back to previous iterations. Just reporting the bug so that it doesnâ€™t appear in 2.2.0 stable release.

I am not seeing any issue with TF 2.1.0 .However i am able to reproduce the issue with TF 2.2.0-rc3. Please, find the gist <denchmark-link:https://colab.sandbox.google.com/gist/ravikyram/eeee97ce61ffb4fbf653ec375fe97fe8/untitled834.ipynb>here.</denchmark-link> .Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ravikyram>@ravikyram</denchmark-link> , I have already used migrated my code from 2.2.0-rc3 to 2.1.0 and 2.0.0. Thanks for gist. Hoping to see this issue resolved in upcoming stable build.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanidhyamangal>@sanidhyamangal</denchmark-link> thanks for reporting the issue. this issue is fixed in the latest tf-nightly and will be available with the upcoming 2.3.0 release.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanidhyamangal>@sanidhyamangal</denchmark-link>
This was also resolved in TF nightly version(). Please check the gist <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/gist/ravikyram/86d88c05a705c79b7ee1df625ef7ccad/untitled44.ipynb>here.</denchmark-link> .You could use tf-nightly for now and in the next couple of months new stable version will be released.Please verify once and close the issue. Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ravikyram>@ravikyram</denchmark-link>
Yes, this one is resolved and I am no longer able to reproduce this issue in new version. Thanks for resolving this.
